review_blob: A very nice ale, with an exceptionaly surprising sweet taste.  Beer is a medium brown with an orange hue.  The smell is warm and pleasant.  The raisin taste is a very nice addition.  Sits in your mouth without any bitterness b/c it is so sweet.  Definitely a quality beer.

A quality IPA.  Not the best or most hops tasting IPA, yet this has something different going for itself.  The hops are still there but they do not hit you like a mack truck does sometimes in IPAs, which means the other tastes come out a lot more.  The beer is amber with slight head. Aroma is hoppy and pleasant. Worth a try for sure.

The pint of this beer had a nice dark black color and little head.  The aroma was rich with chocolate.  The taste was excellent.  Very smooth and after some IPAs that is a welcomed and fresh taste.  Even though I am not a huge fan of porters I can say this is a quality beer no doubt.  I only knock it a little for not having a full taste or much aftertaste.

An IPA from Redhook sounds like a potential killer beer.  The beer however fails mainly on not capturing an exciting taste.  The color is a nice golden orange, with a larger than small head (if that makes sense to you all), and has nice small bubbles.  The aroma is fruity more than hoppy.  The flavor is lacking the main indegredent of an IPA, hops.  This is the beers downfall.  It does not rival other west and north west beers on any hop standard.  I was sad b/c I love the Redhook ESB.  I recommend you try for the sake of trying and then buying some sierra nevada or stone ipa.

This wheat beer pours out with a golden yellow/orange color.  The beer is unfiltered and therefore has a nice cloudy appearance.  The aroma is nothing distinct.  The taste is mild and again not distinct.  Not bitter nor sweet.  A pinch of lemon and spices.  Aftertaste is light and easy to forget.  Not worth the 7 bucks I paid for it.

The beer pours a nice dark black with a brown head.  The aroma has hints of coffee.  The taste is awesome and hard to describe because it is very smooth yet well defined.  The malty aspect of this porter is nicely executed.  I highly recommend this Anchor product.

The color of this beer is brown..duh.  Not much head and very clear.  The aroma is distinctly normal, or in other words unexciting.  Still the beer is tasty and has a nice chocolate side to it.  The beer also has a nice crisp fresh taste which makes it very enjoyable.

This beer is pretty solid at first.  Nice color, slightly off orange.  Not much head though and a little unfiltered.  Aroma is fruity and malty.  taste is nice and combines a hefeweizen with a ale nicely.  The taste is great. My problem, the aftertaste.  This beer is extremely crisp, and by that I mean it is a hit and run in your mouth.  I enjoyed it but wouldn't stock up on it.

A sub par wheat beer with a nice color and aroma.  The beer is nothing special in my book and I find it hard to describe.  It does look nice, especially with the lemon, but the taste is dull and way to crisp.  There is no aftertaste.  The beer is malty and sweet, but not as sweet as the other Two Rows wheat beers or anyother wheat beer.  Maybe i expect more but this beer was very disappointing.

This IPA is the normal Two Rows version.  It is less hoppy and less extreme than their awesome Hopzilla.  The beer has a nice dark brown (still a little transpart) color and the aroma is hoppy and sweet smelling.  The sweetness is also found a little in the taste, which is a trademark of Two Rows.  The beer still is an IPA and still is a solid beer. The aftertaste and palate are excellent.  The little bit of fruit and sweetness add a nice touch to the IPA and make it memorable still.

Two Rows does not have this beer that often.  But it is a solid porter.  Little head (if any) and a dark brown color.  Aroma is faint and the supposed coffee and chocolate is hard to detect.  The same goes for taste.  Nothing stands out.  A plus is this is one of the few Two Rows beers that isn't overally sweet.  The aftertaste is again light and disappointing.

This beer is considered a dark beer but is a cross between a nice dark brown beer and an amber.  The head was about 1-2 cm and the aroma was nice and sweet.  Taste was also nice and sweet with a rich and creamy feel to it.  The beer was not very stout compared to say English stouts but was not really a true doppelbock either.  Aftertaste was full but nothing unique. A good pick up, especially since other Spaten beers are normally not for everyone.

This beer pours with a little head and a nappy orange yellow color.  Slightly cloudy.  Aroma is indistinct.  Taste is very bland.  Crisp and smooth but boring.  Aftertaste is actually skunky and bad.  not recommended at all.

The dark beer of Belize.  Basically modeled after Guinness Extra Stout.  Dark color with little head.  Aroma is distinct and sweet.  The flavor is stout...duh...and hints with some sweetness still.  A solid aftertaste. Grab this beer in Belize and enjoy this more alcoholic and sweeter tropical version of Guinness.

The Bud Light of Belize but better than Bud Light. Actually has a little taste.  Pale golden color with no head or distinct aroma.  Not bad but not worth traveling out of your way to grab.  Though, can't avoid it in Belize so drink it up when there.

Nice dark brown color with slightly brown head that lasts a while.  Aroma is strong, hints of coffee and spices.  The flavor is initally welcoming and pleasant.  Taste lingers for a while with typical West Coast heavy hops.  Still a strong tasting beer that delievers a clean, chrisp, and enjoyable experience.

Cyrstal clear and pale as anything you can think of.  Little head and lots of bubble action.  Aroma is not strong at all. Inital taste is crisp and ends with a smooth aftertaste.  The malty taste is the dominate taste.  A solid average tasting beer, but nothing special.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2004

This beer is nice and hoppy like most S.N. products but is distinctive.  The hop taste is more refined and pleasant than the SN Pale Ale (some people complain). It also is more malty and creamy than the Pale Ale.  The flavor is full and the palate is extremely high with tastes.  Overall it is a nice alternative to the Pale Ale, though harder to find.  Only have seen it in the Gingerman here in Houston (actually on special), which is beer heaven for us Texas folk.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob: After checking out the West Coast Micro selection, I finally found one I do not like at all.  The beer boasts having 43 types of hops, all of which gag you.  I have had my fair share of Cali IPAs but this one failed to taste pleasant, like say Sierra Nevada, and did not test as refined as Stones beers.  I always enjoy variety, and I think I can no reflect more positively on other breweries.  Maybe a fluke review but definitely overrated in my book.

This beer is a true pilsner with a typical and average taste/aroma/appearance. The beer lacks substance, something North Coast's other beer have.  I felt bored and unmotivated to like it.  Though on second thoughts, maybe i was just dissapointed and did not appreciate it is crisp and clean palate (as it claims).  I gave it a couple of tries, some better than others depending on what i had eaten/drank before it.  Still better than crappy Macro pilsners, but still a lackluster beer.

The color is orange and cloudy, like a good wheat beer should be.  Nothing special until you smell it.  The aroma is strong and pleasant.  I almost rather sit for a half hour and smell it than drink it.  The taste is fruity and the raspberry is a nice change.  Interesting palate b/c out of a glass it is nice and mild, but out of a bottle it is awful.  A good beer to try but not as enjoyable as Abita Amber.

I have waited to try this beer b/c of cost, but it is well worth it.  For starters, it has a great dark color and a nice brown fluffy head.  Aroma is strong and varied.  Likewise, the taste has several hints, ranging from Chocolate, to coffee, to some sweet/fruity taste.  Aftertaste is strong and long lasting.  Also, the beer becomes better after it has sit a while and you have had a good amount of it.  Well worth the cost and proof that North Coast is all about quality.
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: A beer by Youngs, with the promise of Honey Brown tatse...not a bad sounding beer.  The aroma is nice, strong, and enjoyable.  Color is orange/brownish and nothing too special.  Taste is sweet but nothing special either.  I would have liked it to be sweeter (so more like Honey Brown) while still staying heavy.  Still, a good average beer from Youngs and worth trying.

I had high expectations for this beer.  Sierra Nevada normally delievers and as I poured it I thought it would.  The color is a murky golden yellow, very dark, and cloudy.  A large fluffy head remained for most of the beer.  The smell was inviting.  However, the taste didn't deliever.  I was sad but it still is tasty.  A little weak on the aftertaste and not much to shout about.
The color is cloudy but still very pale yellow (almost cheap beer golden piss color).  Head is very foamy.  Smell is pleasant but not distinctive.  Not too sweet but still citrus tasting.
One of my favorites.  A great amber color, crisp and stong aroma, and hints of hop and some spice.  Quality tatse, mild and enjoyable aftertaste.  A favorite and worth checking out.

So obviously Budweiser is not the best beer around.  It has a pale yellow appearance and no distinct aroma.  Yet, how is a beer that is so common supposed to stand out as high quality.  Well i guess it can't since its tates is below average compared to the beer people should drink and us beer experts enjoy.  I still will give it props for being better than Miller/Coors or any other standard dead in the water light beer.  It does have some hops to it and some malt, but nothing to get excited or even luke worm about.

Ok, I go to Two Rows a lot, and my main comment is always about how sweet and malty beer is there.  So the Hopzilla fixs it with some qualty hops action and a taste that does not kill me with malt.  It is a nice dark color, almost along the lines of a time tested samuel smiths ale.  The aroma is extremely pleasant and no one smell stands out.  Taste is rich and enjoyable.  Worth it and very refined.  One of the best at Two Rows.

So this beer is a obvious attempt at a mexican/vienna like Negra Modelo or Dos XX.  It does a good job though but then who really wants a copy of crappy mexican imports.  The aroma is dull, color is clear and nappy yellow.  Taste is dry and malty.  As with most Two Rows beer, it is overally sweet but this beer fails to even be unique about it.  Probably the worst Two Rows beer.

A nice red ale with nothing too unique about it.  Though, on second thoughts it warrants credit for being quality brewed and tastes like special care went into it.  As with all Two Rows beer, it is malty and sweet, but not too sweet.  The aftertaste is rich yet easily fades.  I easily say it is one of Two Rows finest.
UPDATED: FEB 11, 2004

This beer defines what TWO ROWS brewery is about; sweetness.  This beer is nice and cloudy, like a hefeweizen should be.  Aroma is nothing special and is confused by the lemon they put on it for garnish.  Still the beer is fun to drink, easy to drink, and tasty.  The beer is malty as with all TWO ROWS beer but is still one of their best and an original buy.  I highly recommend trying if you go.

So TWO ROWs who has a sweet beer handicap has actually made a Sweet Stout that is enjoyable if you like Sweetness instead of Stoutness.  The beer is nice and dark.  Aroma is strong with barley and oatmeal.  Taste is sweet again.  Aftertaste is weak but not unpleasant.  Youngs and Sam Smith make better but maybe lack the fun and good taste that TWO ROWs tries for.

Had this at the restarunt, and was pleased with it as it is the most common beer there according to them.
It is not simple or simliar to common beers on the market.  Color and aroma are nothing special but I enjoyed the taste because it was easy to drink yet complex.  As with all TWO ROWS beer it is sweet and malty, but is not too sweet compared to their others.  Still nothing special but nothing bad.  A good beer to check out if you go this joint.

I don't understand how the last guy hated this beer.  All TWO ROWS beers are too sweet to me, but this beer still has enough good things.  Its color is red brownish with little head.  Aroma has nutmeg and cinnamon present.  Taste like I said earlier; sweet but refreshing.  Aftertaste had no bitternish and was very welcoming.  Still lacked substance but made up with it by being pleasurable and worth it.  Great holiday beer!

Very Black Color, Coffee aroma is present as well as chocolate.  Head is nice and fluffy, a surprise for Sam Adams.  Taste is very stout and heavy but lacks some refinement that i can not describe.  Chocolate/coffee is there, but kind of hits you too hard. Aftertaste is funky but not gross.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2004
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2004
Beautiful Red-Orange Color, hoppy smell and taste, in fact hops dominate taste and other tastes are not as obvious.  Crisp, not as bitter as it could be.  Solid beer and worth checking out.

If you are not in the mood for a Guiness, Harp is a nice, friendly, beer that has a lot of quality, what else could you expect.  Pale but still golden.  Smooth and not very bitter. Great on tap and pretty common these days.

Wow, this beer lives up to its name and prevents me from being a true professional beer drinker.  I personally do not enjoy it but it does have a lot of quality and depth like they claim.  I give it nice props for the appearance which is unique.  I also prefer on tap over bottle, but you have to know a good bar to find it on tap.  Bitter aftertaste could be toned down, i do not need my beer slapping me in my mouth after I drink it. Still a good heavy beer to check out
Better than normal Michelobs, still nothing out of this world.  Surprises = color and quality of taste, still lacks lasting taste or sophistication
Sweet taste and aroma.  Nothing special but a nice average beer.  Is very light and not sweet enough to be a true lager.  Ok, but not worthy of cost.
A nice simple blonde ale. GOlden color that is not cheap looking at all. Little head.  Wheaty.  Worth a try, especially if you like blonde ales or Red Hook.

A lot of people complain about Sam Adams Lager being too much for an average beer.  I disagree but then recommend the Boston Ale.  It is an typical American Ale with a smoother taste than most Ales.  Not as much flavor though.
UPDATED: JAN 16, 2004

Aroma is nothing special.  The appearance is golden and classy looking (as opposed to cheap). A good amount of head for an American/Mexican typical beer. Taste is nice and crisp.  Not much lasting quality to it though.  By far one the best mexican beers.

One of the first beers I ever loved.  It tastes great at first and is still a classic in my book.  Appearance is pretty normal, aroma is pleasant, head is minimal.  The taste is sweet and hoppy. Very smooth.  Easy to drink a few and not notice.  I recommend it and consider it an instant fall back if you don't want a fancy expensive beer and do not want to save money on cheap ass beer.
UPDATED: FEB 11, 2004
